This role needs broad expertise to move forward their sustainable practices, with a specific focus within social sustainability practices.Â§ Â§ Â§PositionÂ§ Â§Reporting to the National Facilities Manager, this role is responsible for supporting the leadership team in implementing initiatives through the collaborative engagement of key stakeholders. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.Â§        Â§The Corporate Support Group underpins everything the Agency does. Â They are an enabler, an advisor and the people who keep the Agency safe. Corporate Support includes Finance, Legal, Risk and Assurance, Research and Analytics, Procurement, and Enterprise Change. For the Agency to be successful, Corporate Support needs to deliver quality services efficiently.Â§        Â§As well as stimulating work, we offer a range of benefits including ongoing professional development, the opportunity to work flexibly (within our operational requirements), 4 weeks annual leave, subsidised health insurance, and an active social club.Â  Â For more information check out :Â§https://www.nzta.govt.nz/careers/our-benefits/Â§        Â§The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahiÂ§        Â§This is a great opportunity for you to use your strong coding skills and focus working with large complex sets of data.This role has a great mix of both hands-on data analysis and strategic focus, so you will be comfortable with being operational as well as providing the big picture view.Â Â Â§        Â§As Principal Analyst (Data)Â you will lead data analytics projects and be a trusted advisor, providing specialist data and analytical expertise to leaders and teams across Waka Kotahi. You will play a key role in identifying opportunities to use data analysis more widely and more effectively throughout the Agency.Â§        Â§With your highly developed communication and relationship building skills, you will develop key relationships both externally and internally to position the team as a strategic partner.Â§        Â§You will also support the continuous improvement of data and Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki Operations Planning team for an Asset Planner looking for a rewarding career contributing to the management of New Zealand's recreational and historic resources.Â  This is an exciting time to join DOC and grow your career within a highly experienced and motivated team environment.Â§          Â§The Department is blessed with more than 72,000 recreational, historic and infrastructure assets - everything from huts and other buildings, signage and interpretation, tracks and walkways, bridges and structures, to campgrounds and toilets.Â  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.Â§          Â§This is a permanent, full-time role based in Hamilton, with the option of flexible working arrangements.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§He angitÅ«tanga: About the RoleÂ§          Â§DOC's Asset Planners play a critical role in ensuring we maximise the use of our investments by helping to establish long-term maintenance programmes and advising on monthly work planning with Rangers.Â  They also provide information to different levels of management, and work as a team of Asset Planners to assist with achieving national consistency.Â§          Â§As one of two Asset Planners in the Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region, you will be a key member of the Operations Planning team.Â§          Â§In this role, you will:Â§          Â§            Â§Develop and maintain the AMIS database for Recreational and Historic work programmes across the districtsÂ§            Â§Ensure accurate reflection of the status of assets and work completedÂ§            Â§Support district staff to schedule work within the asset management toolÂ§            Â§Assign work orders to work groups or individualsÂ§            Â§Maintain equipment master dataÂ§            Â§Be responsible for ensuring work management systems are kept up to date, while working with district Operations teams to develop and prioritise work programmesÂ§            Â§Manage the Department's asset information system to provide quality analysis and reports for decision-makingÂ§            Â§Carry out all planned work to a high standard, on time and within budgetÂ§          Â§          Â§The appointee will join our DOC Operations Planning whÄnau based in Hamilton, supporting the whole of DOC's Hauraki-Waikato-Taranaki region.Â  This team includes a Biodiversity Planner, Recreation Planner, Treaty Partnership & Community Planner, Asset/Maintenance Planners, Inspectors, and Works Officers.Â§          Â§This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our district offices on a regular basis (Coromandel, Hauraki, Waikato, Maniapoto and Taranaki).Â  Good communication skills are essential to successfully build quality relationships with staff in the districts.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§He kÅrero mÅu: What we are looking forÂ§          Â§The ideal applicant will have Asset Planning experience or be skilled at managing computer-based management information systems.Â  They will ideally understand general asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk for visitors.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§The successful applicant will have:Â§          Â§            Â§An understanding of asset/work management principles, practices and systemsÂ§            Â§A proven ability to manage and analyse data to identify risk and provide quality assuranceÂ§            Â§Excellent interpersonal, communication, engagement and relationship management skillsÂ§ desirable.Â  A good knowledge of the facilities used within the recreation/tourism industry and knowledge of construction principles would also be advantageous.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§NgÄ Ähuatanga kei a mÄtou: What's in it for you?Â§          Â§If you love managing and analysing data sets, and have an active interest in outdoor recreation, then this may well be the role for you.Â  If you are risk aware and motivated by working with others to achieve common goals, then we would love to hear from you.Â§          Â§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.Â  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.Â  This is your chance to contribute to principles would also be advantageous.Â§Â Â§Â§NgÄ Ähuatanga kei a mÄtou: What's in it for you?Â§If you love managing and analysing data sets, and have an active interest in outdoor recreation, then Our proven capabilities in high calibre technical asset management, technical facilities management, cleaning, catering, and technical utilities services; the smarts of our more than 8,000 people in all parts of the country; and our well established customer base is the platform for our success and growth.Â§        Â§Our FS&U Transformation Programme will streamline our work management lifecycle to achieve standardised, simplified, effective and cost efficient business processes. model.Â§          Â§Support Operational leaders embedding new work management processes and ensure business process compliance through training, communication, analytics, and continuous improvement initiatives.Â§          Â§Consultation with internal stakeholders and partners on change management activities, priorities and operational delivery.Â§          Â§Ensure clear and early coordination with internal stakeholders on scheduling and delivery against key milestones and financial targets.Â§          Â§Develop and consolidate change management related workstream deployment plans and support reporting against those plans.Â§        Â§        Â§The Change Management Lead will support building internal change management capability, refine fit for purpose approaches, and embed effective deployment solutions.Â  Therefore, to be successful in this challenging role, you will ideally have the following skills and attributes:-Â§        Â§          Â§Experience of 3 â€“ 5 years working for a large organisation in a Project or Change Management capacity, preferable from a large commercial environment.Â§          Â§Proven working knowledge and hands-on experience with deployment of contemporary change management principles, methodologies, engagement practices and implementation plans.Â§          Â§Financial and commercial acumen along with business transformation experience implementing large-scale significant changes to business process, technology and people.Â§          Â§Experience in leading a small high performance team and a clear demonstration of leadership behaviours that empower others.Â§          Â§Effective communication and stakeholder management with the ability to influence, constructively challenge and deal effectively with conflict.Â§          Â§Ability to work in a complex work environment; deal with ambiguity and across functions.Â§          Â§Change Management Certification an advantage.Â§        Â§        Â§A role with us can Our vision is to be the leader in our field by transforming the way we get things done together. deal with ambiguity and across functions.Â§Change Management Certification an advantage.Â§Â§A role with us can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.Â  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.Â  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation.Â  Â Â Â Â§If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 573780 to apply.Â Â Â Â Â§Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.Â§Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a Pre-Employment drug test and medical.Â Â§Due to the fast-paced nature of Downer, our vacancy close dates may be subject to change, so don't delay and make sure you apply as soon as possible. jobTitle: Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50647633.txt	Â§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder RepresentativeÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder RepresentativeÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Land Information New ZealandÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§29 Sept 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Strategy & PlanningÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§  Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative Â§      Â§      Â§      Â§        Â§          Â§Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?Â§          Â§Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?Â§          Â§Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZÂ§        Â§        Â§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.Â§        Â§We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.Â  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.Â  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.Â§        Â§To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.Â§        Â§To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative Â§Consulting SolicitorÂ§ to join us.Â§        Â§Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te KÄhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society). Â As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment.Â Â§        Â§Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.Â§        Â§The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an Â§ex officio Â§member of the Law Society Property Law Sectionâ€˜s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.Â§        Â§This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future.Â Â§        Â§How to ApplyÂ§        Â§To apply, please click "Apply Online." jobText: TXT/50657848.txt	Â§Principal AdvisorÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Principal AdvisorÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Ministry of EducationÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§30 Sept 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§AucklandÂ§, Â§Auckland CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Strategy & PlanningÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.Â§Permanent - full-timeÂ§Provide timely, quality advice and support for operational policy, and internal process management in support of leadership team roles in the property delivery functionsÂ§Help shape the future of educationÂ§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.Â§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.Â§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.Â§ About usÂ§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, creates and supports safe, healthy, inspiring and ICT enabled learning environments. EIS manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, is responsible for the largest payroll in the country, and transports over 100,000 students to and from school each day.Â§ About the roleÂ§Reporting to the Chief Advisor in Wellington, you will support future planning and analysis (looking over the horizon, to support Managers working on day to day matters) in support of the School Property Strategy.Â§Your key accountabilities will include the following:Â§Proactively leading the investigation, monitoring (to ensure any implementation activities are completed) and closure of escalated risks and issues. This will include researching and analysing the impact, challenging assumptions or direction where required, and pulling together options/recommendations for next steps or responses to stakeholders. This may also include leading/supporting resolution activitiesÂ§Supporting senior leaders in the Northern region to develop and deliver projects/strategies, particularly as this relates to roll growth, including personally leading business improvement projects or activities as needed; andÂ§Developing cohesive working relationships and collaboration opportunities with key internal stakeholders to progress projects, promote property delivery's position and strengthen policy and operational tiesÂ§About youÂ§You will have a Tertiary qualification in an appropriate field and will also offer:Â§the ability to take a strategic focus on issues, understand issues within a wider business context, and to develop and implement sound, well-reasoned strategies that achieve the required outcomesÂ§excellent written and verbal communication skillsÂ§strong relationship management and engagement skills, and the ability to quickly establish trust and credibility.Â§If you'd like to bring your skills to a rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.Â§ Are you ready to make a difference?Â§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including MÄori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.Â§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with MÄori students, their whÄnau, hapÅ« and iwi.Â§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. Â§For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at Â§eis.recruitment@education.govt.nzÂ§Â§Applications close midnight on Tuesday, 13 October 2020.Â§Click here to view the role descriptionÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Right to live and workÂ§Â§You must have theÂ§ right to live and work Â§in this location to apply for this job.Â§Â§Â§

jobText: TXT/50689275.txt	Â§20/400 Strategic Investment ConsultantÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§20/400 Strategic Investment ConsultantÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Department of Internal AffairsÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§6 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Management & Change ConsultingÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Type:Â§ Secondment - 12 monthsÂ§Hours:Â§ Full timeÂ§Location:Â§ WellingtonÂ§Business GroupÂ§: Agency Partnerships and Capability Â§Branch:Â§ Digital Public ServiceÂ§Salary:Â§ $129,622 - $175,371Â§Â§                    Â§Â Â Â§Te Tari Taiwhenua/Internal Affairs serves and connects people, communities and government to build a safe, prosperous and respected nation. We deliver value to New Zealanders in many ways â€“ leading digital government, keeping Kiwis safe from harm, supporting strong and resilient communities, strengthening civic participation and governance, and fostering our cultural identity. In other words, we are all about helping to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders.Â Â  Â§Our public service is being called upon to deliver a unified, seamless and effective digital experience so that New Zealanders have the best possible experience of government.Â§  Â§Â  Â§The Digital Public Service branch achieves this by working across the public service to set system direction, connect, influence and support the system to transform and better respond to the ever-changing digital landscape. It also enables the Government Chief Digital Officer (GCDO) to support a modern adaptive public service with the skills, technology and data to operate at pace in a fast-changing digital environment.Â§  Â§Â  Â§The branch has recently redefined its purpose and has reorganised to better meet the needs of a digital public service. This role is the result of this redesign.Â§  Â§Â  Â§Are you an investment specialist looking for a challenging and satisfying new role? We seek people with a deep understanding of how investment supports the achievement of government digital outcomes to join our new team of multidisciplinary consultants.Â§  Â§Â  Â§Working collaboratively with your colleagues you will act as a â€˜change agentâ€™, supporting public sector agencies to develop investment capability to maximise and align their investment to the Strategy for a Digital Public Service.Â  You will do this by:Â§  Â§Being a key liaison between the DPS branch and other central agencies responsible for digital and data investment strategyÂ§Developing a comprehensive understanding of a portfolio of agencies â€“ including their current digital/ICT systems, risksâ€™ and investment and transformation intentions and plansÂ§Providing strategic direction and system outcomes to support agencies to make smart, agile, investment decisions in-line with behaviours in the Strategy for a Digital Public ServiceÂ§Advising agencies about their investment plans, their responsibilities and accountabilities, and ensuring decisions are in line with published frameworks and guidelinesÂ§Supporting the development and maintenance of investment guidelines, information and tools.Â§Â§Â§The ideal candidate will have:Â§Â§A strong knowledge and experience of digital and ICT investment and an understanding of latest trends, thinking, frameworks, legislation and public service investment policy and processesÂ§a comprehensive understanding of how digital investment processes influence and enable successful business changeÂ§experience managing a portfolio of complex and diverse stakeholders, and using intel gathered to inform strategy development.Â§Â§Â§You will also Â§Understand and be able to communicate the benefits of and direction necessary to achieve system digital transformation Â§Â§be an exceptional communicator and be able to give good, pragmatic advice to senior business leaders with confidence, maturity and intelligence.Â§Â§The nature of this role means you may need to have the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance. Â§If you want to join a team of smart, committed people who do some spectacular work for New Zealand â€“ then make sure you get in touch.Â     Â§We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.Â§                    Â§                    Â§To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.Â§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:Â§Â§People can easily access the services and information they need Â§Iwi, hapÅ« and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving Â§People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand Â§New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local governmentÂ§Â§Applications close:Â§ 5pm, Wednesday 21 October 2020Â§For more information please contact:Â§ Paul Jordan at Â§Paul.Jordan@dia.govt.nzÂ§Job description:Â§ To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§

It also enables the Government Chief Digital Officer (GCDO) to support a modern adaptive public service with the skills, technology and data to operate at pace in a fast-changing digital environment.Â§  Â§Â  Â§The branch has recently redefined its purpose and has reorganised to better meet the needs of a digital public service. This role is the result of this redesign.Â§  Â§Â  Â§Are you an investment specialist looking for a challenging and satisfying new role? We seek people with a deep understanding of how investment supports the achievement of government digital outcomes to join our new team of multidisciplinary consultants.Â§  Â§Â  Â§Working collaboratively with your colleagues you will act as a â€˜change agentâ€™, supporting public sector agencies to develop investment capability to maximise and align their investment to the Strategy for a Digital Public Service.Â  You will do this by:Â  Â§Â  Â§Developing a comprehensive understanding of a portfolio of agencies â€“ including their current digital/ICT systems, risksâ€™ and investment and transformation intentions and plansÂ§Supporting agencies to make smart, agile, investment decisions to bring digital transformation to the agency in-line with behaviours in the Strategy for a Digital Public ServiceÂ§Advising agencies about their investment plans, their responsibilities and accountabilities, and ensuring decisions are in line with published frameworks and guidelinesÂ§Supporting the development and maintenance of investment guidelines, information and tools.Â§The ideal candidate will have:Â§  Â§A strong knowledge and experience of digital and ICT investment and an understanding of latest trends, thinking and frameworksÂ§a comprehensive understanding of how digital investment processes influence and enable successful business changeÂ§experience managing a portfolio of complex and diverse stakeholders, and using intel gathered to inform strategy development.Â§Â§You will also be an exceptional communicator and be able to give good, pragmatic advice to senior business leaders with confidence, maturity and intelligence.Â§The nature of this role means you may need to have the ability to obtain and maintain a Confidential security clearance.Â§Â§If you want to join a team of smart, committed people who do some spectacular work for New Zealand â€“ then make sure you get in touch.Â  Â§We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.Â§To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.Â§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:Â§Â§People can easily access the services and information they need Â§Iwi, hapÅ« and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving Â§People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand Â§New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local governmentÂ§Â§Applications close:Â§ 5pm, Wednesday 21 October 2020Â§For more information please contact:Â§ Julie Watson at Â§Julia.Watson@dia.govt.nzÂ§Job description:Â§ To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§

jobText: TXT/50694815.txt	Â§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial TransportÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial TransportÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§NZ Transport AgencyÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§7 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§OtagoÂ§, Â§DunedinÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Strategy & PlanningÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§  Â§    Â§    Â§Portfolio Manager - Safer Commercial Transport Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§          Â§This is an exciting and important new role in a new team, and you have the chance to make it your own.Â§          Â§It's a great opportunity to help develop a better approach to regulating commercial transport in New ZealandÂ§          Â§You'll be responsible for national portfolios and regulatory assurance programmes aimed at improving long-term behavioural change and safetyÂ Â§          Â§Locations: Auckland (Upper North Island), Hamilton (Central North Island), Wellington (Lower North Island), and Christchurch or Dunedin (South Island)Â§        Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§About us |Â Ko wai mÄtouÂ§        Â§ At Waka Kotahi NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depend on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years' time.Â§        Â§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives.Â Â Â§ Â§ We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for the public. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity).Â§        Â§To view our regulatory strategyÂ§ : Â§please visit Â§Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand FirmÂ§        Â§Our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, effective, efficient and functions well for everyone in New Zealand.Â§        Â§Being a real-world regulator means:Â§        Â§We take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§The opportunity |Â Te Whiwhinga mahiÂ§        Â§The purpose of the Portfolio Manager role is to take ownership of developing and driving strategy, business planning, with oversight of operational delivery of the national safer commercial transport regulatory function. The goal is innovation with clear focus on outcomes, partnerships looking for win win outcomes that lock in long term behavioural change, and effectiveness and efficiency to achieve the biggest bang for our buck from our resources.Â§        Â§We are looking for someone with vision and flair who can bring a fresh approach to our business. We need someone who is innovative, can build relationships with industry, will take calculated risks to achieve outcomes, and has a proven ability to get things done. You'll enjoy working as part of a close, collaborative team, and you'll have a clear vision and the freedom to get things done. You'll own your role and will be responsible for the business outcomes.Â§        Â§In this exciting new role you'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Safer Commercial Transport. This is a great opportunity for someone with energy and talent who is ready to embrace the challenge of shaping a senior role.Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§About you | Ko koe tÄ“neiÂ§        Â§To be successful in this role, you will bring:Â§        Â§          Â§Proven experience in bringing together multidisciplinary teams from across sectors to solve large complex issues.Â§          Â§Experience in creating a motivational work environment and enabling high performanceÂ§          Â§Experience leading change management and continuous improvement initiatives to drive performance and build capabilityÂ§          Â§Experience in leading, influencing and building credibility across a range of stakeholders to drive behaviour changeÂ§          Â§An understanding of regulatory practice particularly within the Government context would be helpfulÂ Â§        Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§Applications close |Â RÄ Katinga :Â Wednesday, 21 October 2020Â§        Â§For a copy of the position description:Â Â§www.nzta.govt.nz/careersÂ§        Â§For further information, email:Â Â§careers@nzta.govt.nzÂ§        Â§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.Â§        Â§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. jobTitle: Senior Change Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50701766.txt	Â§Senior Change ManagerÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Senior Change ManagerÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§WestpacÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§7 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§AucklandÂ§, Â§Auckland CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Management & Change ConsultingÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Senior Change ManagerÂ§ Â§Full time, PermanentÂ§ Â§Located in Britomart, AucklandÂ§ Â§ Â§In a world where change is the only constant, we know that the key is to improve the capability of people to adopt, manage and embrace change. The Change Practice at Westpac is an enterprise wide function that enables our people to be ready and able to adopt change so that value is delivered into the hands of our customers.Â§ Â§ Â§About the Opportunity:Â§ Â§ Â§We currently have a rewarding Senior Change Manager position available, which offers the opportunity to be part of a major transformational project implementing future state processes to ensure compliance with regulatory obligations relating to outsourcing. Â Â Â Â§ Â§The Senior Change Manager role will support both simple and complex change initiatives to ensure our people are ready to adopt change, minimise disruption to the business and maximise delivered value.Â§ Â§ Â§Key components of the role include:Â Â§ Â§ Â§Making upcoming changes visible via the Change Forecast and providing stakeholders with decision support adviceÂ§ Â§Engaging with stakeholders to identify and manage change impactsÂ§ Â§Building change capability in agile teams and enabling them to self-serve for simple changeÂ§ Â§Directly managing change for high impact / complex initiatives and measuring change effectivenessÂ§ Â§ Â§The person weâ€™re looking for:Â§ Â§ Â§Weâ€™re looking for someone with proven Change Management skills and experience and who has held Change Manager positions in large organisations. Ideally, you would have experience and exposure in delivering Risk and regulatory changes in a banking environment. Facilitation is key in this position as are strong influencing skills. Equally, you need to be comfortable presenting to and working with stakeholders at all levels, with the ability to adapt your style to suit the audience. Youâ€™ll need to be organised, have an eye for detail and feel at ease juggling multiple priorities. Youâ€™ll love working with people and have the perfect balance of empathy, resilience and drive to deliver.Â Experience in leading a small team of change managers would be ideal. Â Â§ Â§ Â§What you will need to succeed:Â§ Â§ Â§5+ yearsâ€™ recent experience in change management roles, preferably in the Banking / Financial Services sector.Â§ Â§Experience delivering change relating to one or more of the following: Complex Risk and Regulatory change programmes, Risk culture or organisational culture development initiatives and data management related programmes in a banking environment.Â§ Â§Ideally, direct experience of delivering change in Agile environments and familiarity with the principles of Agile operation. Added bonus if experienced working with human centred design and have experience in adult learning, education and/or training.Â§ Â§Familiarity with change management frameworks and techniques (e.g. Prosci, ADKAR, Lean Change), with the ability to adapt and apply. Â Â§ Â§Excellent stakeholder management skills and a collaborative working style and comfortable operating at all levels of the organisation.Â§ Â§Proven ability to coach individuals and teams to deliver effective change.Â§ Â§Outstanding written and oral communication skills â€“ ability to tell a story.Â§ Â§Resilience and an openness to learn and iterate are keys to succeeding in our environment.Â§ Â§ Â§Whatâ€™s great about working for Westpac?Â§ Â§ Â§Weâ€™re passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. The role is fixed-term for 12 months, to really drive and embed improvements to our planning reporting practices.Â§        Â§About YouÂ§        Â§We are seeking applications from people with strong experience in leading and supporting organisational planning and best practice performance reporting and measurement. jobText: TXT/50709470.txt	Â§Programme Manager - East and Northwest HamiltonÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Programme Manager - East and Northwest HamiltonÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Hamilton City CouncilÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§8 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WaikatoÂ§, Â§HamiltonÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Management & Change ConsultingÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Our City Growth Group is growing the Hamilton of the future. Every decision we make is contributing to the Hamilton of tomorrow, next year, next decade. Weâ€™re building a city that people are attracted to live and do business in now - while creating sustainable, vibrant communities as we continue to grow. Weâ€™re ambitious about the impact we can have for the city â€“ join us to get your hands on shaping the Hamilton of today and maximising the opportunities of its growth.Â§We have an opportunity for a Programme Manager to join our Growth Programmes team. In this role youâ€™ll initially be focussed on leading the overall delivery of the Ruakura (and eastern growth areas) and the Rotokauri (and northwest growth areas). Youâ€™ll build and lead a virtual, cross organisational team of multidisciplinary project managers and technical staff to ensure that they work together in a joined up way to deliver wellbeing outcomes for these new communities. Your daily focus will be on leading, communicating and corralling our internal teams and working closely with our Elected Members and key external partners including developers, landowners and key government agencies. Youâ€™ll also lead some specific projects, such as Business Cases, to support decision making on long term future investment into growth areas.Â§The right person for this role will have significant experience in Project or Programme Management. You may be a Project Manager looking to take your next step into Programme Management role. You do not need to be an engineer, a planner or a technical expert as we have those people in place delivering the projects. Your job will be to set up the temporary Programme frameworks that enable those teams to work together. You will have experience working in a complex, large work environment be it international, local government or from the private sector. High on your list of skills will be the ability to quickly form trusting relationships, the ability to lead people towards a common vision, outstanding communication skills and the ability to learn quickly and to see and implement new ways of doing things. You will also be highly organised and able to lead and prioritise your workload.Â§We are looking for a high-performer who is energised and ready to take on a new challenge. Youâ€™ll be joining a creative and supportive team who has your back, and will provide context and training to set you up to succeed.Â§This is a full-time role, based in central Hamilton. Our team can work from anywhere and mixes virtual with in-house, however the influential nature of the role means that you need to be in the building for a large portion of each week.Â§ Â§Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together. This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.Â§ Â§For a copy of the position description please click Â§ HEREÂ§.Â§ Â§The recruiting range for this role starts at $98,000 per annum and will be negotiated with the successful candidate in accordance with skills, knowledge and experience.Â§ Â§If this role sounds like itâ€™s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!Â§ Â§All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates will be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, and a Ministry of Justice check.Â§ Â§Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§

jobText: TXT/50732639.txt	Â§Business Improvement Analyst - One Year FTCÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Business Improvement Analyst - One Year FTCÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Public TrustÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§13 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§AucklandÂ§, Â§Auckland CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§AnalystsÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest and most experienced trustee services organisation. We provide specialist advice and care across a range of trust, estate management and investment services to New Zealanders.Â§We are undergoing a transformation in the way we deliver to our customers, making more of our products available online, as well an integrating this technology with our 26 customer centres throughout the country. This newly created fixed term role will work across our business to support with the development, integration and decommissioning of our technology, to create better experiences for our people, customers and communities and our financial outcomes.Â§About the roleÂ§We're looking for an experienced analyst to support and advise on the integration of 'PT online' with our existing programmes, and work through the process of decommissioning programmes that are being retired. You will explore how our customer centres operate and the best ways to integrate our new platform and processes.Â§You will work with subject matter experts and leaders to understand the root cause of the issue or opportunity and work with the business to identify and implement the appropriate solution using a human centred design approach.Â§Underpinning this work is our strategic aspiration to grow a sustainable trustee and supervisory services business that is compelling, relevant and accessible to all New Zealanders, which we will achieve by placing equal focus on our people, our customers and communities and our financial outcomes.Â§Flexibility is integral to the way we work, and therefore the location of this role is flexible, with a preference for someone who is able to spend some of the time working in one of our larger offices in Auckland or Wellington. You will have the ability to work from home if that is a preference.Â§Ideally we would like someone who is able to start as soon as possible but we can wait until after the Christmas break for the right candidate.Â§What we're looking forÂ§Personality and the right attitude is key, as we need someone who can build positive relationships with stakeholders, understand our strategy, systems and processes quickly and show a determination to get things done! In addition:Â§5+ year's experience with business and process analysis, solution design, business process mapping, reporting and analytics and/or the project management of system solutions in a commercial business environmentÂ§A relevant tertiary qualification with Lean Six Sigma Orange belt would be an advantage; ADKAR, Agile, Prince2 or PMP are a bonus but not essentialÂ§Understanding or experience using human centred design is an advantageÂ§Well established stakeholder engagement and management and effective communication skills are essential as you will need to converse across the organisation, facilitate the resolution of conflicting stakeholder requirements and achieve buy inÂ§Understanding of business case development especially as it relates to cost benefit analysisÂ§Strong understanding of process and business improvement, including an ability to present and report on complex information in a simple mannerÂ§Customer focus and the ability to translate this into effective strategies.Â§In returnÂ§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.Â§To ApplyÂ§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.Â§For any queries please email us at Â§recruitment@publictrust.co.nzÂ§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).Â§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Wednesday 28th October 2020.Â§Â§Â§Â§Right to live and workÂ§Â§You must have theÂ§ right to live and work Â§in this location to apply for this job.Â§Â§Â§

jobText: TXT/50722133.txt	Â§Senior Governance AdvisorÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Senior Governance AdvisorÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§NZDFÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§12 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§SalaryÂ§Â§$86308 - $106616 including 4% super contributionÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§PolicyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§What you will doÂ§In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for the provision of expert governance advice, analysis and monitoring to enable effective and efficient NZDF governance systems, policies, processes and controls across Defence Estate and Infrastructure (DEI).Â§You will also be responsible for:Â§Providing secretariat support and, professional advice and guidance to senior level governance boards and committees across DEI;Â§Promoting and upskilling the DEI team in good decision-making and quality assurance;Â§Preparing presentations and documentation and maintaining the document management system; andÂ§Coordinating and managing preparation and distribution of regular Estate performance management reports.Â§This is an exciting time to join our team; you will be able to utilise your governance experience to support the integration of our new Alliance services partnership model.Â§What we need Â§This role requires sound understanding of governance within the public sector at a senior level. Â You will have an ability to think methodically, establish and maintain sound processes and systems, and respond quickly to complex issues. Â You will be adaptable and flexible to meet changing needs.Â§You must also have:Â§Confidence with policy analysis techniques and a demonstrated ability to apply these to produce high quality policy advice;Â§Political savvy with the ability to work with ease in the internal political environment;Â§Proactive and effective management skills for internal and external relationships, conscious of organisational reputation; andÂ§A high degree of sensitivity with the ability to liaise with confidence and influence personnel at all levels.Â§Who we areÂ Â§Defence Estate and Infrastructure develop, maintain and manage land, property and infrastructure assets in order to support NZDF military capabilities and all of government outcomes, through the Defence Estate Regeneration Programme. The Defence estate comprises over 80,000ha of land with infrastructure and buildings with a replacement value of some $2.8bn. Defence Estate and Infrastructure is gearing up for major reinvestment and recapitalisation work over the coming years to 2025.Â Â§Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand. Â As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crisis at short notice.Â Â§Why UsÂ§NZDF is an inclusive organisation that is open to flexible working arrangements and welcomes applications from people regardless of gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, age, beliefs/opinions, or family circumstances.Â§In return for your expertise and dedication, NZDF is offering remuneration reflective of your experience, along with:Â§Great benefits for you and your familyÂ§;Â§Fully funded life cover up to $300,000;Â§Discounts Handbook for selected retail, entertainment and service providers;Â§5 weeks annual leave per year;Â§Flexible working environment and positive culture;Â§Opportunities for career development.Â§How to ApplyÂ§To view the Position Description and to Apply Online please visit our Â§Defence CareersÂ§ website, or use the links on this page.Â§Please note:Â§ If you are an existing NZDF employee (excluding contractors) you must apply through our Internal Vacancies site, via the HR Toolkit.Â§Applications close on Â§Monday 26 October 2020Â§.Â§Please note: Â§Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand (NZ) and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position applied for. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the NZ Defence Force are as follows:Â§Low level Security ClearanceÂ§most preferably a NZ citizen, who Â§has resided in this country continuouslyÂ§ for at least the last Â§five yearsÂ§, ORÂ§is a citizen of, Â§and/or has resided continuouslyÂ§ in one or more of the following countries for the last Â§five yearsÂ§: either Australia, Canada, NZ, the United Kingdom (UK) or the United States of America (USA); Â§andÂ§ has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at this level.Â§If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.Â§Â§Â§Â§Right to live and workÂ§Â§You must have theÂ§ right to live and work Â§in this location to apply for this job.Â§Â§Â§

This means that here at the AA you'll be surrounded by proud, passionate people who love a challenge, work as one and enjoy our unique team spirit.Â§About the role:Â§The Operations Manager will be the bridge between the AA Retail Centres and key product stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of product solutions and services. You will drive customer experience and the ability of the Centre Network to deliver agreed performance results.Â§We have 37 centres across New Zealand with over 70 different products and services. You will design and manage the Operational Framework for the Centre Network, this will encompass end-to-end business processes, risk management, customer feedback and knowledge management systems, productivity modelling, reporting.Â§We want you to bring a fresh and dynamic approach to leading outstanding, empathetic customer interactions; creating a robust framework in the process.Â§Skills and experience required:Â§You'll need to be all over the process of sales and have proven experience in risk and compliance, as well as coaching, developing techniques and resources to motivate and lift process capability. jobText: TXT/50757476.txt	Â§Senior Advisor, Workforce Strategy and PolicyÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Senior Advisor, Workforce Strategy and PolicyÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Ministry of HealthÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§16 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§PolicyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§  Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§Senior Advisor, Workforce Strategy and Policy Â§      Â§      Â§      Â§        Â§          Â§Are you experienced in developing and providing high quality and objective advice on cross-government issues?Â§          Â§Are you wanting to play a key role in developing and working on new initiatives for New Zealand's health workforce?Â§          Â§Are you a problem solver who is comfortable working to challenging timeframes and dealing with complex subject matter?Â§        Â§        Â§The response to the COVID-19 pandemic has put the health and disability system in the spotlight like never before. We are responsible for providing active stewardship and leadership across the nations health and disability system. We ensure the system provides people with the highest levels of care, regardless of who they are or where they live.Â§        Â§You will find a copy of the Position Description online at Â§www.careers.health.govt.nzÂ§        Â§For further information, contact Â§recruitment@health.govt.nzÂ§        Â§Please click Apply for this Job to upload your CV and cover letter.Â§        Â§Advertising for this role closes at midnight on Friday, 30 October 2020.Â§        Â§We encourage diversity and inclusion at the Ministry of Health and are committed to equal opportunity in all our employment policies and procedures. jobText: TXT/50765540.txt	Â§Asset Specialist, BiodiversityÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Asset Specialist, BiodiversityÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Department of ConservationÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§18 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WaikatoÂ§, Â§HamiltonÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Strategy & PlanningÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§  Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§        Â§Asset Specialist, Biodiversity Â§        Â§          Â§An exciting opportunity has become available within our Asset Management Unit for an Asset Specialist to manage New Zealand's biodiversity resources.Â Â§          Â§The Department is blessed with a wide variety of built biodiversity assets that protect our flora and fauna - from boundary fencing, predator control fencing, bivouacs, aviaries, quarantine control buildings and accommodation facilities.Â  Don't miss the opportunity to help DOC manage these great assets.Â§          Â§This is a permanent, full-time role, location and working arrangements are flexible by negotiation outside of main centres.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§He angitÅ«tanga: About the RoleÂ§          Â§The Asset Management Unit provides an effective and integrated asset management system across the Department's visitor, heritage and biodiversity assets. Â Â The Asset Specialist plays a critical role in providing national asset management of our built biodiversity assets.Â  The role works closely with their national and regional planning colleagues around the country and the Biodiversity Unit.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§As one of four Asset Specialists, you will be a key member of the Asset Management Unit and the wider Operations Planning team.Â§          Â§In this role, you will:Â§          Â§            Â§Create and manage asset management plans in accordance with Departmental strategies, guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)Â§            Â§Operationalise the national policies and standards developed by the Biodiversity unitÂ§            Â§Provide asset management advice and supportÂ§            Â§Ensure national consistency across the management of assetsÂ§            Â§Support relevant internal and external stakeholdersÂ§            Â§Define, manage, oversee and monitor reporting requirementsÂ Â§            Â§Keep up to date with international industry developmentsÂ§            Â§Provide national oversight and quality assurance of asset inventoriesÂ§            Â§Work with the Asset Management team to improve Departmental asset management practiceÂ§            Â§Assist in asset management of other asset classes as neededÂ§            Â§Organise and manage collection of asset inventory informationÂ§            Â§Undertake and organise asset valuationsÂ§            Â§Provide advice on departmental asset insurance mattersÂ§          Â§          Â§This is largely an office-based role; however, you will need to meet with teams in our national, regional and district locations on a regular basis.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§He kÅrero mÅu: What we are looking forÂ§          Â§The ideal applicant will have Asset Management experience in a similar or local/national government infrastructure environment.Â  You will ideally understand contemporary asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk to biodiversity.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§The successful applicant will have:Â§          Â§            Â§Experience in the management of built biodiversity assets including aviaries, hatcheries and various types of predator proof fencesÂ§            Â§Understanding and experience in asset condition assessment and preparation of asset management plansÂ§            Â§Understanding of levels of service, strategic goals, risk management, resiliency, criticality and life cycle managementÂ§            Â§Knowledge of, and experience in, implementing international best practice asset management standardsÂ§            Â§An understanding of conservation and how it relates to asset managementÂ§            Â§Experience in working proactively with stakeholders to achieve successful outcomesÂ§            Â§Current full driving licence requiredÂ§          Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§NgÄ Ähuatanga kei a mÄtou: What's in it for you?Â§          Â§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.Â  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.Â  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.Â§          Â§We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. however, you will need to meet with teams in our national, regional and district locations on a regular basis.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§He kÅrero mÅu: What we are looking forÂ§          Â§The ideal applicant will have Asset Management experience in a similar or local/national government infrastructure environment.Â  You will ideally understand contemporary asset management practice with the ability to apply messaging and advice to maximise our investment and minimise risk to biodiversity.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§The successful applicant will have:Â§          Â§            Â§Experience in the management of built biodiversity assets including aviaries, hatcheries and various types of predator proof fencesÂ§            Â§Understanding and experience in asset condition assessment and preparation of asset management plansÂ§            Â§Understanding of levels of service, strategic goals, risk management, resiliency, criticality and life cycle managementÂ§            Â§Knowledge of, and experience in, implementing international best practice asset management standardsÂ§            Â§An understanding of conservation and how it relates to asset managementÂ§            Â§Experience in working proactively with stakeholders to achieve successful outcomesÂ§            Â§Current full driving licence requiredÂ§          Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§NgÄ Ähuatanga kei a mÄtou: What's in it for you?Â§          Â§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.Â  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.Â  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.Â§          Â§We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. however, you will need to meet with teams in our national, regional and district locations on a regular basis.Â§Â Â§Â§He kÅrero mÅu: What we are looking forÂ§The ideal applicant will have Asset Planning experience or be skilled at managing computer-based management information systems.Â Â§The successful applicant will have:Â§Â§Experience in the management of visitor and heritage assets and supporting infrastructureÂ§Understanding and experience in asset condition assessment and preparation of asset management plansÂ§Understanding of levels of service, strategic goals, risk management, resiliency, criticality and life cycle managementÂ§Knowledge of, and experience in, implementing international best practice asset management standardsÂ§An understanding of conservation and how it relates to asset managementÂ§Experience in working proactively and collaboratively with stakeholders to achieve successful outcomesÂ§Current full driving licence requiredÂ§Â§Â Â§Â§NgÄ Ähuatanga kei a mÄtou: What's in it for you?Â§This is a great opportunity to join a large organisation that's still growing.Â  DOC has been undergoing a steady period of growth, and we highly value the new expertise and fresh perspectives being brought into the organisation.Â  This is your chance to contribute to our culture of continuous improvement.Â§We offer a fantastic supportive and collaborative working environment. Being the multiple award winner of the most attractive employer in the public sector (and second overall) with an average turnover beyond 10 years, we know people generally really enjoy working with us!Â§Â Â§Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory - this includes holding a valid work visa that covers the whole period of employment.Â§Please apply online via the DOC Careers CentreÂ§ with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the requirements above.Â Â§For any enquiries, please contact Steve Ilkovics, Â§silkovics@doc.govt.nzÂ§, ph 027 310 8191,Â§ quoting vacancy Â§400/99350.Â§Â§Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 2 NovemberÂ 2020.Â§DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture. We offer a range of flexible working options depending on the needs of the role and its work context.Â Â§Â§Â§Â§

jobText: TXT/50777580.txt	Â§Senior AnalystÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Senior AnalystÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Ministry of JusticeÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§20 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§AnalystsÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Senior Analyst (with a focus on data science), Sector Analysis and Modelling Sector Group National Office Â§Â§MOJ/1490071Â§Â Â§Te Ähuatunga a te tÅ«ranga/About the Role Â§Sector Group is a multi-disciplinary team that brings together the best of strategy, policy, data analysis, research and evaluation capabilities to inform decision making by justice agency leaders. As a Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and driving a work programme to build the evidence base for key decisions in the Justice Sector. However, this role has a focus on data science and provides the right candidate with the opportunity to develop and lead our use of advanced analytics.Â§Â Â§He pÅ«kenga tou/Skills and ExperienceÂ§Your experience will demonstrate the ability to contribute across a range of analytical disciplines including, forecasting, modelling and advanced analytics. You will be good at managing large data sets and have experience in SAS and/or R. Most importantly you will be curious and motivated, keen to explore but ready to deliver.Â§You may be a talented young analyst looking for the next career step or an existing Senior Analyst looking for the chance to take more functional leadership. You will likely have a degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, statistics or engineering. You will be pragmatic and agile, being able to move between action, and thought, orientation. You will have experience in a modelling environment and be both curious and proactive. Most importantly you will be able to demonstrate the ability to understand the context and work with sector stakeholders to deliver outputs supported by all the sector parties.Â§A permanent role in this team has not become available in quite some time, so don't miss out on this opportunity to bring your enthusiasm to this motivated team. It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.Â§Â Â§Tono mai/How to ApplyÂ§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.Â§Applications close on Tuesday 27 October 2020Â§If you have any questions, please contact Â§recruitment@justice.govt.nzÂ§Â Â§Â§Â§Â§

Are you looking to develop your career or just make a difference? Make your next opportunity your best opportunity by joining the Ministry of Justice's Sector Analysis and Modelling team.Â§This is a sort after opportunity to take a senior role in an established and high performing team delivering outputs that drive investment in the Justice Sector. As a Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and driving a work programme to build the evidence base for key decisions in the Justice Sector. Your experience will demonstrate the ability to contribute across a range of analytical disciplines including, forecasting, modelling and advanced analytics. You will be good at managing large data sets and have experience in SAS and/or R. Justice Sector experience is a plus but not necessary.Â Â§You will be a Senior Analyst looking for a change with a degree in a quantitative discipline such as mathematics or statistics or you will be a high performing Analyst ready to take the next step in your career. You will be pragmatic and agile, being able to move been action, and thought, orientation. You will have experience in a modelling environment and be both curious and proactive. Most importantly you will be able to demonstrate the ability to understand the context and work with sector stakeholders to deliver outputs supported by all the Sector players.Â§A permanent role in this team has not become available in quite some time, so don't miss out on this opportunity to bring your experience to this enthusiastic and motivated team.Â§Â Â§MÅ te tÄ«ma/About our TeamÂ§Â§About the Sector Group:Â§Sector Group is a multi-disciplinary team that brings together the best of strategy, policy, data analysis, research and evaluation capabilities to inform decision making by justice agency leaders. It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.Â§Â§Â Â§Â Â§Tono mai/How to ApplyÂ§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.Â§Salary Range:Â  $99,413 to $116,956Â§Applications close Thursday 5 November 2020Â§Please contact Lyndsey Rothwell for more information on Â§Lyndsey.Rothwell@justice.govt.nzÂ§You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for this role.Â§Â Â§Â§Â§Â§

jobText: TXT/50800669.txt	Â§Business AnalystÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Business AnalystÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Southern District Health BoardÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§22 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§OtagoÂ§, Â§DunedinÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§AnalystsÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§New Dunedin HospitalÂ§Â§Be part of this once in a lifetime projectÂ§Â§Friendly, supportive teamÂ§Permanent position with room for growthÂ§Â§About usÂ§The New Dunedin Hospital Programme Management Office team works closely with SDHB staff, the Ministry of Health and the Health Planners and Architects involved with designing our new hospital. Our team consists of Project Managers and Business Analysts who have their own areas of expertise, a Programme Director, Communications Advisor and Project Coordinator supporting the team. As the New Dunedin Hospital Programme grows and develops, our team will too - that's where you come in!Â§About the opportunityÂ§We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst to complement our team who are currently in the design phase of the New Dunedin Hospital project. This position will allow you to utilise your skills in data gathering, financial forecasting, analysis and data insights to help inform the decisions that will ultimately shape the healthcare service delivery model of the future. You will work to support both project and clinical teams as we navigate the design phase and move through to making the New Dunedin Hospital a reality.Â§The key responsibilities of this role include (but are not limited to) the following:Â§Assisting with maintenance and improvement of financial modelling for the Hospital RedevelopmentÂ§Providing longer term financial forecastingÂ§Gathering of data and analysing to support decision making around business initiativesÂ§Building and maintaining relationships with a range of key stakeholders, including clinical staff and external organisationsÂ§Analysis around workforce planningÂ§About youÂ§Ideally you will be a Chartered Accountant with a few years post graduate experience under your belt for this position. However, we are looking for the right person to complement our project team and while experience is important, it isn't everything. Your attitude and willingness to learn will also go a long way to helping you succeed.Â§Ideally you will bring the following:Â§Experience of working in a complex project environmentÂ§Experience with costing and project accountingÂ§Knowledge of database management and accessing data from a range of data sourcesÂ§Strong analysis skills with the ability to turn large data sets into insightful intelligenceÂ§The ability to build rapport easily with people of diverse skills and a diverse range of backgroundsÂ§Some experience within the health sector would be beneficialÂ§This really is a once in a lifetime project to get involved in and your analysis and financial expertise will help to shape the decision making that will impact the healthcare of our region for generations to come. If that gets you excited, and you think you have what it takes to succeed, we'd love to hear from you!Â§Why Dunedin?Â§If you're not already here and are considering a move, there's a lot of reasons to pack your bags! The Southern district offers the benefits of excellent amenities, first class primary through to tertiary education, affordable housing and outstanding recreational opportunities. Whether it is surfing, kayaking or sailing; skiing, hunting or fishing; theatre, live-music or art - there's literally something for everyone. Check out Â§https://southernhealthcareers.nz/Â§ for what the region and we can offer you and your whanau.Â§Closing date: Thursday, 5 November 2020.Â§For further information please contact Sarah Burgess Recruitment Advisor, Corporate Directorate, SDHB on Â§03 470 9021Â§.Â§To applyÂ§We only accept online applications. Please apply via our website: Â§www.southernhealth.nzÂ§Click here to view the role descriptionÂ§Â§Â§Â§

jobText: TXT/50672065.txt	Â§Water Team LeaderÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Water Team LeaderÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Awa EnvironmentalÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§2 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Environment & Sustainability ConsultingÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§The OpportunityÂ§ Â§Are you looking to take the next step in your career? The role will involve project delivery and client management responsibilities, so we're looking for someone with strong consulting experience and an interest in helping to build Awa's capability and culture.Â§ Â§About Awa EnvironmentalÂ§ Â§Awa Environmental is a New Zealand based, employee owned professional service provider with expertise in engineering, water, geospatial analysis and hydrological modelling. We support public and private sector clients in NZ and the UK with flood risk assessment, catchment planning, water sensitive design and the design and delivery of three waters infrastructure including municipal scale pipe networks and pump stations. We also support our clients with asset planning and management services including business case development and long-term planning.Â§ Â§We're passionate about making a positive impact on the environment. Our success is built on a reputation for high quality, pragmatic project delivery and we're now giving back through a number of environmental impact investments. As we grow, we're committed to maintaining a relaxed, collaborative culture where our team feel trusted and supported to do their best work. You will be joining our business experience hub, alongside working across multiple squads creating an exceptional digital experience for our people so they can deliver great customer outcomes. You will be integral part of the team to ensure our people, and our customers are prepared and ready to adopt change, while minimising disruption to our business and maximising delivered value.Â§ Â§ Â§Key components of the role include:Â Â§ Â§Enabling stakeholders to deliver great customer outcomes through change adoption plans that includes assessment and measurement of change impacts, people readiness and the extent of the change adopted Â§ Â§Building change capability in our business and squads teams, enabling them to self-serve for simple change Â§ Â§Directly managing change for high impact / complex initiatives alongside measuring change effectiveness Â§ Â§Making upcoming changes visible via the Change Forecast and providing stakeholders with decision support advice to enable our people to have the best chance of adopting and embedding the change.Â§ Â§What you will need to succeed:Â§ Â  Â§The role is pivotal to ensuring our customer facing people are prepared and ready to adopt change. Proven experience supporting a technical systems transformation programme is essential. Ideally, this will also include business banking experience and an understanding of working with a customer relationship management system. Â§ Â§ Â§You will be adept at navigating through an agile world and a more traditional banking structure so that both are aligned to deliver an exceptional digital banking experience. Taking people on the journey with you is what you do every day. Partnering with different chapters such as Service Design and co-creating with squad members and end users and being able to challenge where needed to achieve the overall outcome is part of your DNA. You will come with a sound change management toolkit, be able to link all the threads together and be able to adapt your approach depending on what will add the most value for our people and customers. Â§ Â§ Â§Importantly, you will make the time count that you have with our super busy customer facing people who are in the process of transitioning and embedding a significant structural and cultural transformation programme. Importantly, you will be apt at operating both tactically on the ground and thinking strategically with no two days being the same as our bank moves to ignite financial possibilities for our customers.Â§ Â§ Â§Key skills:Â§We are looking for someone with exceptional Change Management skills and experience and who has held Change Manager positions in large and complex organisations. Ideally, you would have experience delivering cultural transformation around shifting mindsets and behaviours to align with business strategy that is focussed squarely on our customers and our peopleâ€™s end-to-end experience. Working in a business banking environment would be an advantage.Â§Â  Â§Facilitation is key in this position as are strong influencing skills and ability to think on your feet comes naturally to you.Â  Equally, you need to be comfortable presenting to and working with stakeholders at all levels, with the ability to adapt your style to suit the audience. You will need to be organised, have an eye for detail and feel at ease juggling multiple priorities. You will love working with people and have the perfect balance of empathy, resilience and drive to deliver to outcomes.Â Â§ Â§Â Â§ Â§Whatâ€™s great about working for Westpac?Â§ Â§We are passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, youâ€™ll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme.Â§ Â§Â Â§Interested?Â§ Â§Apply today with your CV and cover letter via the link on this page.Â§ Â Â§Â Â§Â Â§Â Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§
