jobText: TXT/50814816.txt	Â§Senior Hydrologist or Hydraulic ModellerÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Senior Hydrologist or Hydraulic ModellerÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Awa EnvironmentalÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§26 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Environment & Sustainability ConsultingÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§The OpportunityÂ§ Â§Are you looking to take your modelling career to the next level while working in a smaller organisation where you can directly influence outcomes and benefit from your efforts?Â§ Â§This is a unique opportunity for a senior hydraulic modeller or hydrologist to join our growing Wellington team. The role is to help develop our service offering in the fields of water modelling and flood risk assessment within broader water infrastructure and catchment planning projects. Having already established ourselves as one of New Zealandâ€™s leadingÂ suppliers of hydraulic modelling and related geospatial services, we enjoy a strong client base and pipeline of work.Â  Â Â§ Â§This will be a technical role with hands on modelling, scenario analysis and client relationship responsibilities. You will be responsible for scoping, estimating and planning the delivery of projects to meet client expectations and relevant industry standards/ statutory requirements. The role focus will be on running computer-based, mathematical models of wastewater, stormwater and river systems to test scenarios and understand environmental impacts. 1D network, 2D floodplain and coupled 1D/2D modelling will be applied as needed for different projects. As Awa relies heavily on our in-house software development capability, you'll have opportunities to contribute ideas and effort into building our own technology.Â§ Â§About Awa EnvironmentalÂ§ Â§Awa Environmental is a New Zealand based, employee owned professional service provider with expertise in engineering, water, geospatial analysis and hydrological modelling. We support public and private sector clients in NZ and the UK with flood risk assessment, catchment planning, water sensitive design and the design and delivery of three waters infrastructure including municipal scale pipe networks and pump stations. We also support our clients with asset planning and management services including business case development and long-term planning.Â§ Â§We're passionate about making a positive impact on the environment. Our success is built on a reputation for high quality, pragmatic project delivery. As we grow, we're committed to maintaining a relaxed, collaborative culture where our team feel trusted and supported to do their best work. Everything we do is reflected in our core values of Â§Excellence, Heart Â§and Â§Innovation.Â§ Â§About YouÂ§ Â§You will be a driven and innovative thinker, keen to contribute to building Awa's capability and culture. You will have significant consultancy experience and be seeking the opportunity to take on more responsibility to further develop your career.Â§ Â§You will be confident in managing projects, identifying new opportunities and scoping new work. You will be excited to pass on your model knowledge to others and eager to develop further as a professional consultant.Â§ Â§A bachelors degree in environmental management, earth science, geography, engineering or related discipline is required, with postgraduate or double degree preferable.Â You will be ableÂ to demonstrate:Â§ Â§ Â§5-8 years experience using hydraulic modelling software applications such as DHI's modelling suite (Mike Flood, Urban, Mike 21, Mike 11),Â InfoWorks ICM or TuFlow. Exposure to other modelling tools such as EPANET, SewerGEMS, SewerCAD, InfoSWWM, XPSWMM, PCSWMM will be useful but not requiredÂ§ Â§proficiency in ArcGIS or QGIS for mapping and analysisÂ§ Â§ability to work with and analyse monitoring data such as rainfall and tide recordsÂ§ Â§ability to project manage client work and delegate tasks to others in the project teamÂ§ Â§ability to produce information for flood risk assessments and lead summary reportingÂ§ Â§a practical, real-world approach to developing modelling solutions, and aÂ keen interest in contributing to Awa's modelling software and automation practicesÂ§ Â§ability to translate and communicate complex technical information to clientsÂ§ Â§an eye for detail,Â but able to keep the big picture in mindÂ§ Â§a desire to look out for the well-being of colleagues and othersÂ§ Â§entitlement to work in New Zealand because you are a New Zealand or Australian citizen or have, or are working towards, permanent residencyÂ§ Â§Some additional skills that would be beneficial include:Â§ Â§ Â§experience in water infrastructure design and deliveryÂ§ Â§experienceÂ  with public and private sector clientsÂ§ Â§experience working with engineering design tools such as Civil3D, 12D and/or AutoCADÂ§ Â§a practical attitude and a keen interest in helping to develop and innovate Awa's delivery processesÂ§Â§Â§Â§The application form will include these questions:Â§Â§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?Â§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?Â§What's your expected annual base salary?Â§Â§Â§

The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. Waka Kotahi has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time.Â§        Â§This is an exciting time for the Regulatory Services Group as we set ourselves up for future success delivering end-to-end regulatory services that are sharply focused on outcomes and delivering our regulatory purpose and objectives. We have a rare opportunity to drive positive change that will make a difference to the way we work and the outcomes we can deliver for New Zealand.Â§        Â§As the lead regulator for land transport our purpose is to ensure that the system is safe, efficient, effective and operates in the public interest. Safety is a top priority for Waka Kotahi and we, as the Regulatory Services group, aim to improve safety and reduce the risk of harm by being a firm and fair real-world regulator applying principles of good practice grounded in Te Ao Maori - Whakapono (Integrity), Manaakitanga (Caring for people), Whanaungatanga (Relationships) and Kotahitanga (Unity). Being a real-world regulator means we take a systems view that is focused on improving safety outcomes and reducing harm, we work to understand why people behave the way they do and are pragmatic in how we respond, we encourage and educate to support people to comply and enforce compliance when necessary.Â§        Â§We encourage you to explore our regulatory strategy Â§Tu Ake, Tu Maia - Stand Up, Stand FirmÂ§to learn more about our path to becoming a responsive regulator for the real world.Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§Te Whiwhinga mahi | The opportunityÂ§        Â§The purpose of the Agencies Performance Analyst role is to ensure compliance within the driver licensing and motor vehicle system by educating, auditing and building a culture of willing compliance of contracted agents and providers. This includes the collection of data and information relating to the performance of the agents and reporting on this information. The role also has the function of ensuring that vital services of the Transport Agency are provided to all customers in a consistent fashion across New Zealand.Â§        Â§You will work with a range of agents and suppliers around the country to educate and audit their compliance with the driver licensing and motor vehicle systems, so you will enjoy building relationships and influencing stakeholders. You will use your strong written communication skills and eye for detail to write detailed audit reports and findings.Â  You'll get the opportunity to work towards improving the customer experience and ensuring the vital services of the Transport Agency are provided to all customers across New Zealand in a consistent manner.Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§Ko koeÂ tÄ“nei | About youÂ§        Â§To be successful in this role you will bring:Â§        Â§          Â§A willingness to travel regularlyÂ§          Â§The ability to be inquisitive, ask the right questions and influenceÂ§          Â§Excellent verbal and written communication skillsÂ§          Â§Have a dynamic and enthusiastic personality who easily engages with a diverse range of peopleÂ§          Â§A strong understanding and experience of audit processesÂ§          Â§Strong report writing skills and a good eye for detail and accuracyÂ§          Â§A track record of building and sustaining working relationships with internal and external stakeholders and customersÂ§          Â§Strong computer literacy skills (Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook)Â§          Â§The ability to read and understand legislationÂ§          Â§An understanding of driver licensing and motor vehicle processes would be an advantageÂ§          Â§A full and clean NZ drivers licenseÂ§        Â§        Â§Â Â§        Â§RÄ Katinga | Applications close: Wednesday, 11 Nov 2020Â§        Â§For a copy of the position description: Â§www.nzta.govt.nz/careersÂ§        Â§For further information, email: Â§careers@nzta.govt.nzÂ§        Â§To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.Â§        Â§NZ Transport Agency is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). jobText: TXT/50819790.txt	Â§Senior Co-design ConsultantÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Senior Co-design ConsultantÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Te Kaihau LtdÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§27 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Hutt ValleyÂ§Â§SalaryÂ§Â§$100,000 - $109,999 base plus commissionÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Management & Change ConsultingÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Te Kaihau Ltd is a small consultancy based in Wellington that focuses on growing leaders to innovate for a better future.Â  We work with the government to foster innovation through co-design with stakeholders, facilitating peer support for intrapreneurs in the public sector, organisation development to remove barriers to innovation, and coaching.Â Â  We work with universities running our programmes to raise innovation capability with a social purpose.Â  Te Kaihau won a United Nations Alliance of Civilizations and BMW award for our global impact on fostering cross-cultural leaders in social enterprise to address the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. Â  Â Â§ Â§Te Kaihau has several projects that need an injection of skills in co-design to pull together public sector organisations with their stakeholders to make new ideas happen.Â§ Â§The successful candidate will lead Te Kaihauâ€™s co-design consultancy work, and contribute to Te Kaihauâ€™s wider business to grow leaders who innovate for a better future.Â Â§ Â§The key focus of this role is to develop new co-design projects that link the public sector to their stakeholders.Â  Outcomes from these processes are improved joint diagnosis of issues, joint problem solving, joint decision making, joint implementation, and joint accountability.Â  Results may include improved legislation, funding mechanisms, social equity, social development, efficiency, effectiveness, and cross-agency relationships.Â§ Â§Â Â§ Â§Responsibilities and Duties:Â§ Â§Lead Te Kaihauâ€™s co-design opportunities. There are two current opportunities:Â Â§ Â§ Â§There is an immediate opportunity to support the public sector and stakeholders in a process to successfully implement the medical cannabis legislation.Â  The project may also extend to support for developing and implementing the recreational cannabis legislation depending on the outcome of the referendum. Â Â High level skills are needed in co-design, facilitation, education process, and group process.Â  Knowledge is also needed in the cannabis industry, especially medical cannabis.Â§ Â§There is an emerging project to co-design and implement a process that raises higher order education in tertiary education organisations.Â§ Â§Contribute to Te Kaihauâ€™s other projects:Â§ Â§ Â§The Global Enterprise Experience (www.geebiz.org) is a global programme that won a UNAOC award for its global impact on fostering leadership, UNSDGs, social entrepreneurship and cross-cultural skills across the participants from 700 universities and 100 organisations in 120 countries.Â  The programme would benefit from skills in raising sponsorship, developing a UNSDG award, and growing the coaching programme to support participants.Â§ Â§Export Bridge links universities, mainly in the United States, to New Zealand emergent exporters to provide market research and market development.Â  The programme would benefit from marketing it to additional universities.Â§ Â§PeerUp (www.peerup.nz) facilitates public sector intrapreneurs to provide peer coaching to colleagues to help them make public sector projects happen.Â  The programme won an open tender with the New Zealand Treasury and State Services Commission as an avenue for fostering efficiency and effectiveness in the public sector.Â  The successful applicant may be asked to set up and facilitation some of these group coaching programmesÂ§ Â§Two new experiential education qualifications are under development to foster innovation in the public sector.Â  These qualifications would benefit from contribution to educational design and marketing.Â§ Â§We have ongoing organisation development consultancy work with boards, senior management and high growth entrepreneurs.Â  High level skills are needed in facilitation, governance, strategic thinking, venture capital financing, innovation and business development.Â§ Â§Contribute to Te Kaihauâ€™s marketing and performance through:Â§ Â§ Â§Strategic planning and collaboration with Te Kaihau colleaguesÂ§ Â§Business developmentÂ§ Â§Build and maintain client relationshipsÂ§ Â§Attract sponsorship for the Global Enterprise ExperienceÂ§ Â§Undertake personal development in skills useful to Te KaihauÂ§ Â§Â Â§ Â§Personal RequirementsÂ§ Â§ Â§High level co-design experience and knowledge, especially developing joint solutions between the public sector and stakeholdersÂ§ Â§Knowledge of the medical cannabis industry, including public policy implicationsÂ§ Â§Experience in the tertiary education sectorÂ§ Â§Innovation experience and knowledgeÂ§ Â§High level facilitation skillsÂ§ Â§Experience in designing and leadingÂ effective inter-agency workshops that lead to changeÂ§ Â§Knowledge of governance, management and business strategyÂ§ Â§Proven business development capabilityÂ§ Â§A passion for experiential educationÂ§ Â§Strong skills working across culturesÂ§ Â§Â Â§ Â§The position is based in the organisationâ€™s Wellington office.Â§ Â§Confidential enquiries and applications should be directed to Deb Gilbertson at Te Kaihau Ltd by Tuesday 10 November 2020.Â§Â§Â§Â§

We have helped clients gain planning permission for major projects and developments worth more than $20 billion, including:Â§Entire new towns and suburbsÂ§Dozens of commercial/retail developmentsÂ§NZ's largest gas field (Maui)Â§NZ's largest mussel farmÂ§A $400 million 5-star hotel/convention facility in Papua New GuineaÂ§A $250 million infant milk formula plant in PokenoÂ§The velodrome and cycling centre of excellence in CambridgeÂ§The $100 million upgrade of the Skyline Gondola and Luge in QueenstownÂ Â§The expansion of Millbrook Resort & The Hills Golf Courses in ArrowtownÂ§In addition, we are New Zealand's leading economic experts on local infrastructure funding, and have helped dozens of Council and developer clients to negotiate funding agreements worth hundreds of millions of dollars.Â§About the roleÂ§We seek a contract analyst/writerÂ to work remotely (preferably in Auckland) on a wide range of exciting projects. The role will entail:Â§Identifying and summarising documents/reports.Â§Collating and analysing data in Excel to produce report tables and graphs.Â§Producing maps in GIS software (or using various online GIS tools),Â Â§Helping to write reports and evidence for hearings.Â§Occasionally attending client meetingsÂ§The work involves a significant amount of spatial analysis, including working with GIS systems and large amounts of spatial data. However, excellent writing skills are the most important facet of this position.Â§The successful applicant will work in a largely-autonomous manner, ideally from home or your preferred remote location, to provide support to our principal consultants.Â Â§Given the contractual nature of the work, we are unable to guarantee a certain number of hours each week. However, the successful canidate should be available to work an average of 30 hours per week, and sometimes up to 40 hours during busy periods. If you cannot spare this much time per week, please do not apply.Â§Benefits and perksÂ§The successful candidate will benefit from:Â§Competitive remuneration.Â§A flexible "work from home" role.Â§Being part of a small, agile, and friendly team.Â§A diverse range of interesting work on multiple projects across various industries and sectors.Â§An opportunity to work autonomously and hone your analytical, writing, and consulting skills.Â§Helping a wide range of NZ businesses to meet their goals by securing planning permission for a wide range of property developments and other major projects.Â§Â Â§Skills and experienceÂ§The ideal candidate will have:Â§An undergraduate or post graduate degreeÂ in economics, geography, or town planning.Â§At least five years commercial experience in a related/relevant field.Â§A strongÂ analytical background and and ability to think creatively to solve problems.Â§ExcellentÂ oral and written communication skills, including the ability to present complex issues clearly and concisely.Â§Strong time management skills with the ability to work across multiple projects.Â§Self-motivated and diligentÂ with a positive "can do" attitude.Â§Excellent keyboard/computer skills.Â§A sound knowledge of Excel and other Office products.Â§Experience with district plans and/or resource consent processes is strongly preferred but not a prerequisite.Â§Â Â§Â Â§Â§Â§Â§The application form will include these questions:Â§Â§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?Â§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?Â§How would you rate your English language skills?Â§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?Â§What's your expected hourly rate?Â§Â§Â§

New Zealand's environment, our economy and trade and our way of life are underpinned by a strong biosecurity system. Our actions have been very successful in protecting New Zealand from incursions of almost all pests and diseases that could cause significant harm. We can be proud of what we achieve every day. However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing risk pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. Biosecurity New Zealand needs to make some changes to ensure the system is fit for the future and we can continue to support strong trade and economic growth in an increasingly uncertain world.Â§          Â§We want to be in a position where we can continue to strengthen the biosecurity system over the coming decade. We need to be set up well to become more influential and outward-facing and have excellent business systems and processes in place to support us and the farmers, growers and communities we work for. Â§As a result, we have a number of new vacancies across Biosecurity New ZealandÂ§, Â§including a Principal Adviser.Â§          Â§MÅ tÅ mÄtou rÅpÅ« (About our team):Â§          Â§Pre-border covers all the activities that contribute to reducing the likelihood that harmful pests and diseases will arrive at our border. The work we do here ensures the vast majority of biosecurity risk is managed offshore. Producers, exporters, exporting country competent authorities and importers all take action to comply with the requirements contained in our import health standards (IHSs) and Craft Risk Management Standards. These requirements, and the actions to verify compliance at the border, work together to provide New Zealand with an appropriate level of protection and reduce biosecurity risk to an acceptable level, while enabling trade and travel to occur.Â§          Â§Te whainga poto o tÄ“nei tÅ«ranga (What is the purpose of this position?):Â§          Â§A key position in the Animal & Plant Health Directorate, and as part of the leadership team, the Principal Adviser has responsibility for providing strategic leadership and shaping key work programmes for the Animal & Plant Health Directorate.Â§          Â§As the Principal Adviser, you will be a systems thinker who understands the scope and purpose of the biosecurity system and the role played by the Animal & Plant Health directorate.Â  You will understand how to support the director in the delivery of a significant programme of core work, substantial change programme, and injecting thought leadership into the biosecurity system. This is a varied role in a large directorate, requiring a broad set of business, policy and biosecurity skills to be applied to proactively lead and troubleshoot as required.Â§          Â§This role will ensure we are putting our energy into the right areas, communicating effectively and delivering on our promises. The Principal Adviser will be a problem solver and help others to find ways through complex issues.Â§          Â§NgÄ PÅ«kenga me ngÄ Wheako(Skills & Experience):Â§          Â§Ideally, the successful candidate will be able to demonstrate significant experience in thought leadership, coupled with Â a previous track record of successful strategic leadership, with high level strategic capability and ability to maintain a clear focus on long term goals will enable you to succeed.Â§          Â§Key to your success will be your ability to see the â€˜big picture' and have flexibility to adapt to changing public and political pressures whilst maintaining an evidence-based approach.Â§          Â§If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application.Â Â§          Â§Ahurea - (Culture):Â§          Â§We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. The Principal Adviser will be a problem solver and help others to find ways through complex issues.Â§NgÄ PÅ«kenga me ngÄ Wheako(Skills & Experience):Â§Ideally, the successful candidate will be able to demonstrate significant experience in thought leadership, coupled with Â a previous track record of successful strategic leadership, with high level strategic capability and ability to maintain a clear focus on long term goals will enable you to succeed.Â§Key to your success will be your ability to see the â€˜big picture' and have flexibility to adapt to changing public and political pressures whilst maintaining an evidence-based approach.Â§If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application.Â Â§Ahurea - (Culture):Â§We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.Â§Â Â§Â§To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please clickÂ Â§hereÂ§Â§Â Â§Â§NgÄ hua o te Mahi i te ManatÅ« Ahu Matua: - (Benefits of working at MPI):Â§Â§Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave daysÂ§Â§Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisationÂ§Â§Wellness benefit for employeesÂ§Â§Â Â§Tonu mai inaianei (Apply now):Â§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site.Â For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.Â§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - clickÂ Â§hereÂ§Â to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.Â§In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand.Â§The successful applicant must be able to obtain the relevant security clearance Please visitÂ Â§http://www.mpi.govt.nz/about-mpi/careers/apply/security-clearanceÂ§Â for more information.Â§For information please refer to the position description on the MPI careers website or email Â§jolene.ingram@mpi.govt.nzÂ§Â  Â§Â Â§Applications close 16 November 2020Â§Â Â§The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. This senior leadership role is focused on shifting our strategic intentions by leveraging technology and culture change to deliver great customer experiences, drive operational performance, and achieve our purpose of Stronger Connections, Better New Zealand. Working collaboratively with the KiwiRail Group Executive and Leadership Teams, you will champion and embed a cultural change across the organisation to ensure revenue and cost targets are achieved across the KiwiRail Group. This role is accountable for our sustainability function for the business as part of it's wider remit.Â§To be considered for this opportunity you will have senior leadership expertise within large, complex organisations supported by solid experience in a transformational or strategy role. Your breadth of experience will include working closely with senior leadership teams in driving investment and growth opportunities while ensuring the operations have sustainable processes and systems to support the transformation. You will be a thought leader, collaborative in your approach in leading transformational business growth and change including cultural change. Naturally you will be highly innovative with strong commercial and financial acumen and the ability to identify growth and revenue opportunities.Â§Â§Â§Â§Right to live and workÂ§Â§You must have theÂ§ right to live and work Â§in this location to apply for this job.Â§Â§Â§

Here at Greater Wellington Regional Council, we're working on the big things that will impact everyone in our region. Ensuring we have uninterrupted access to drinking water, staying safe from the threat of flooding, protecting and enhancing the environment, improving the quality of our fresh water, ensuring we are all connected through our public transport network and planning ahead for the potential impact of climate change across our region. We're also all about growing our people through professional development and experience across everything the council does.Â§About the role:Â§This role sits within the Corporate Planning and Reporting team, which is responsible for leading and developing Greater Wellington's statutory and non-statutory corporate planning and reporting documents, frameworks and processes (for example Long Term Plans, Annual Plans, Annual Reports, Business Plans and Quarterly Reports). The team is part of the Strategic and Corporate Planning Department, which supports Greater Wellington to be a strategy-led organisation, and is also responsible for climate change strategy and regional parks planning.Â§Skills and experience required:Â§To be successful in this role you will need to be a self-starter, able to manage competing priorities on a wide-range of projects, work with councillors and senior management, as well as engage with the community.Â§You will need to have:Â§Â§the ability to lead a business process or project from end-to-endÂ§a good understanding of the issues facing local or regional governmentÂ§strong analytical skills with the ability to understand and summarise dataÂ§a proactive approach to problem solving and the courage to go and talk to people.Â§Â§Â Â§How to apply:Â§Click on the link to view the job description and to apply for the role with a cover letter and CV.Â§For further information, please contact Zofia Miliszewska, Team Leader, Corporate Planning and Reporting, 021Â 951Â 545 or Â§zofia.miliszewska@gw.govt.nzÂ§.Â§Applications close: Â§Monday 23 November 2020.Â§Â§Only people with the right to work in New Zealand may apply for this position. Previous programme management experience and strong networking skills?Â§ Â§Our client cares about the best possible health outcomes for New Zealanders. Its role is to make responsible choices, that are not always easy.Â  Â Their work impacts on people, families, whÄnau and our wider society â€“ and they take their responsibility very seriously.Â Working with others in the health sector, they use robust evidence-based processes and never stop using ingenuity to make things better. The position is very much one of informing, engaging, and bringing together disparate groups within the MÄori equity programme of work.Â Underpinned by an organisational priority â€“ Equity for MÄori â€“ you will relish adding your own professional and life experiences and cultural competency into a framework set up for now, and into the future.Â§ Â§We are looking for someone with a proven track record of delivery and a strong understanding of the health sector, with demonstrable skills in designing and implementing projects and initiatives that make a positive difference for whÄnau MÄori. jobText: TXT/50844107.txt	Â§ Senior Business AnalystÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§ Senior Business AnalystÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Ministry for Primary IndustriesÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§29 Oct 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§AnalystsÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§  Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§        Â§Whatungarongaro te tangata toitu te whenuaÂ§          Â§As man disappears from sight, the land remainsÂ§        Â§        Â§ Senior Business Analyst Â§        Â§          Â§Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi Â§          Â§With your contribution and my contribution the people will prosperÂ§          Â§Â Â§          Â§MÅ te Tiakitanga Putaiao AotearoaÂ§          Â§Our biosecurity system protects New Zealand from pests and diseases that would harm our economy, environment, and way of life. We have been very successful in protecting New Zealand from incursions of almost all pests and diseases that could cause significant harm. We can be proud of what we achieve every day. However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing import pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. We also play an important role in enabling two-way trade to benefit consumers and the economy.Â Â§          Â§Biosecurity New Zealand is making changes to ensure the system is fit for the future and we can continue to protect New Zealand while supporting strong trade and economic growth in an increasingly uncertain worldÂ§.Â  We have a vacancy as a Senior Business Analyst.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§MÅ tÅ mÄtou rÅpÅ« (About our team):Â§          Â§Pre-border biosecurity work covers all the activities that reduce the likelihood of harmful pests and diseases arriving at our border and establishing in New Zealand. This work includes influencing international trade standards, negotiating with trading partners, setting import regulations, auditing trading partner export systems, commissioning research, and monitoring import pathway performance.Â  These ensure the vast majority of biosecurity risk is managed before it even hits New Zealand's border.Â Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§Te whainga poto o tÄ“nei tÅ«ranga (What is the purpose of this position?):Â§          Â§Our focus is on developing, maintaining and improving the business process and systems that support operational delivery.Â§          Â§Our Senior Business Analyst will support the directorate in its project planning, forecasting, risk and issues management, reporting requirements and, to act as a key coordination point for these activities across the organisation. The position also provides business analysis and support in the development of improved business processes within the Directorate. A large proportion of the work will be project-based, ranging in scope and size initially to support change initiative projects. In this role you will be expected to provide advice and support to decision makers across Biosecurity New Zealand.Â§          Â§We are looking for smart people who can navigate across our organisation, with an ability to work across groups towards agreed solutions.Â  If you see yourself as an enabler of change, like to crack hard problems, and find joy in influencing towards new ideas, then we seek your contribution.Â§          Â§We are looking for either a Senior Adviser or Senior Analyst to join our team.Â  Our ideal candidate will be a strong conceptual thinker balanced with a pragmatic approach to problem solving and implementation.Â  They will have excellent communication and relationship management skills, and a high drive for results.Â  You have a talent to foster collaborative engagement across any level of the organisation, being a key influencer for the uptake for change and new ways of working.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§NgÄ PÅ«kenga me ngÄ Wheako (Skills & Experience):Â§          Â§We are keen to tap into some advanced skillsets including:Â§          Â§            Â§Experience in a project environmentÂ§            Â§Knowledge and understanding of the impact of regulation and the ability to assess benefits, risks and costsÂ§            Â§Experience with a range of different project management tools and techniquesÂ§            Â§At least 5 years relevant experience preferably across a range of organisations/ industriesÂ§            Â§Understanding of the public sector and the machinery of governmentÂ§            Â§Experience that involves provision of advice, analysis, internal consultation and engagement, and interaction with senior decision makersÂ§            Â§Have a sound understanding of how a business works, its core components, and how these fit together to efficiently and effectively deliver its core products or services to meet customers/stakeholders requirementsÂ§            Â§Skilled in business requirements identification, gathering and assessment.Â§            Â§Having the ability to clearly and quickly identify and define the issue, problem, or opportunity in an assigned areaÂ§            Â§Skilled in developing appropriate plans/approaches to collect and perform the required analysisÂ§          Â§          Â§In this role you will be expected to provide advice and support to decision makers across Biosecurity New Zealand.Â§          Â§If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application.Â Â§          Â§Salary range for this role is $92,000 to $108,000 depending on skills and experience.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§Ahurea - (Culture):Â§          Â§We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please clickÂ Â§hereÂ§          Â§Â Â§          Â§NgÄ hua o te Mahi i te ManatÅ« Ahu Matua: - (Benefits of working at MPI):Â§          Â§            Â§Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave daysÂ§            Â§Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisationÂ§            Â§Wellness benefit for employeesÂ§          Â§          Â§Further information around the benefits of working for MPI can be watchedÂ§ hereÂ§          Â§Tonu mai inaianei (Apply now):Â§          Â§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site.Â For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.Â§          Â§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - clickÂ Â§hereÂ§Â to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.Â§          Â§In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand.Â§          Â§The successful applicant must be able to obtain the relevant security clearance Please visitÂ Â§http://www.mpi.govt.nz/about-mpi/careers/apply/security-clearanceÂ§Â for more information.Â§          Â§For information please refer to the position description on the MPI careers website or email Â§jolene.ingram@mpi.govt.nzÂ§Â  Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§Applications close 13 November 2020Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.Â§          Â§Â Â§          Â§Â Â§        Â§        Â§        Â§      Â§    Â§    Â§  Â§Â§Â§Ma tau rourou, ma taku rourou, ka ora te iwi Â§Â§With your contribution and my contribution the people will prosperÂ§Â§Â Â§Â§MÅ te Tiakitanga Putaiao AotearoaÂ§Our biosecurity system protects New Zealand from pests and diseases that would harm our economy, environment, and way of life. We have been very successful in protecting New Zealand from incursions of almost all pests and diseases that could cause significant harm. We can be proud of what we achieve every day. However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing import pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. We also play an important role in enabling two-way trade to benefit consumers and the economy.Â Â§Biosecurity New Zealand is making changes to ensure the system is fit for the future and we can continue to protect New Zealand while supporting strong trade and economic growth in an increasingly uncertain worldÂ§.Â  We have a vacancy as a Senior Business Analyst.Â§Â Â§MÅ tÅ mÄtou rÅpÅ« (About our team):Â§Pre-border biosecurity work covers all the activities that reduce the likelihood of harmful pests and diseases arriving at our border and establishing in New Zealand. This work includes influencing international trade standards, negotiating with trading partners, setting import regulations, auditing trading partner export systems, commissioning research, and monitoring import pathway performance.Â  These ensure the vast majority of biosecurity risk is managed before it even hits New Zealand's border.Â Â§Â Â§Te whainga poto o tÄ“nei tÅ«ranga (What is the purpose of this position?):Â§Our focus is on developing, maintaining and improving the business process and systems that support operational delivery.Â§Our Senior Business Analyst will support the directorate in its project planning, forecasting, risk and issues management, reporting requirements and, to act as a key coordination point for these activities across the organisation. The position also provides business analysis and support in the development of improved business processes within the Directorate. A large proportion of the work will be project-based, ranging in scope and size initially to support change initiative projects. In this role you will be expected to provide advice and support to decision makers across Biosecurity New Zealand.Â§We are looking for smart people who can navigate across our organisation, with an ability to work across groups towards agreed solutions.Â  If you see yourself as an enabler of change, like to crack hard problems, and find joy in influencing towards new ideas, then we seek your contribution.Â§We are looking for either a Senior Adviser or Senior Analyst to join our team.Â  Our ideal candidate will be a strong conceptual thinker balanced with a pragmatic approach to problem solving and implementation.Â  They will have excellent communication and relationship management skills, and a high drive for results.Â  You have a talent to foster collaborative engagement across any level of the organisation, being a key influencer for the uptake for change and new ways of working.Â§Â Â§NgÄ PÅ«kenga me ngÄ Wheako (Skills & Experience):Â§We are keen to tap into some advanced skillsets including:Â§Â§Experience in a project environmentÂ§Knowledge and understanding of the impact of regulation and the ability to assess benefits, risks and costsÂ§Experience with a range of different project management tools and techniquesÂ§At least 5 years relevant experience preferably across a range of organisations/ industriesÂ§Understanding of the public sector and the machinery of governmentÂ§Experience that involves provision of advice, analysis, internal consultation and engagement, and interaction with senior decision makersÂ§Have a sound understanding of how a business works, its core components, and how these fit together to efficiently and effectively deliver its core products or services to meet customers/stakeholders requirementsÂ§Skilled in business requirements identification, gathering and assessment.Â§Having the ability to clearly and quickly identify and define the issue, problem, or opportunity in an assigned areaÂ§Skilled in developing appropriate plans/approaches to collect and perform the required analysisÂ§Â§In this role you will be expected to provide advice and support to decision makers across Biosecurity New Zealand.Â§If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a dynamic team, we would encourage you to submit an application.Â Â§Salary range for this role is $92,000 to $108,000 depending on skills and experience.Â§Â Â§Ahurea - (Culture):Â§We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture. We are fair in our behaviour and our policies promote equal opportunity for all. We provide numerous training programmes and opportunities for people to continuously improve their skill sets and keep up to date with global best practices. MPI has a focus on career pathways so this is the first step in your career with us and we will help you grow.Â§Â Â§Â§To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please clickÂ Â§hereÂ§Â§Â Â§Â§NgÄ hua o te Mahi i te ManatÅ« Ahu Matua: - (Benefits of working at MPI):Â§Â§Up to three additional (MPI holidays) leave daysÂ§Â§Career development and internal opportunities across the branch and organisationÂ§Â§Wellness benefit for employeesÂ§Â§Further information around the benefits of working for MPI can be watchedÂ§ hereÂ§Â§Tonu mai inaianei (Apply now):Â§To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site.Â For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.Â§To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - clickÂ Â§hereÂ§Â to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.Â§In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand.Â§The successful applicant must be able to obtain the relevant security clearance Please visitÂ Â§http://www.mpi.govt.nz/about-mpi/careers/apply/security-clearanceÂ§Â for more information.Â§For information please refer to the position description on the MPI careers website or email Â§jolene.ingram@mpi.govt.nzÂ§Â  Â§Â Â§Applications close 13 November 2020Â§Â Â§The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. Your unique talents and experience will help us deliver exceptional services to our communities in Aotearoa. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. We actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so that we can assist you through the recruitment process.Â§Â Â§Â Â§Â§Â§Â§

jobTitle: Transport Planner (New Plymouth) Job in Taranaki - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50860003.txt	Â§Transport Planner (New Plymouth)Â§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Transport Planner (New Plymouth)Â§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§BecaÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§2 Nov 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§TaranakiÂ§, Â§New PlymouthÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Strategy & PlanningÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§  Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§Transport Planner (New Plymouth) Â§      Â§        Â§Â§        Â§Transport Planner (New Plymouth)Â§        Â§          Â§Shape the transport network across the lower North island, providing strategic consultancy servicesÂ§          Â§Support the delivery of transformational transport planning projects, while learning from some of the best in the industryÂ§          Â§Develop your career and work across a multi discipline consulting firm, while having the benefits of living in New PlymouthÂ§        Â§        Â§The opportunity | Te kÄinga ruaÂ§        Â§Develop your Transport Planning and consulting career, while supporting the delivery of transport planning projects across all aspects of the transport network. You will be working across a broad range of tasks with leading Transport Planners, to deliver a range of projects across the transport planning function. You will be joining a nation-wide team with an enviable track record, known by our clients for delivering key strategic transport projects. We lead projects of all sizes for a diverse group of clients and work as an integrated team of over 70 Transport Planners, engineers, traffic modellers and technical experts operating from Beca locations throughout New Zealand.Â§        Â§As well as supporting Palmerston North, and surrounding local authorities, understanding the impact of transport on their network we also work with other clients such as New Plymouth Hospital, Sports Taranaki, Taranaki Regional Council and Waka Kotahi - NZ Transport Agency. As a Transport Planner you will enjoy problem solving, looking for ways to assist our clients in finding a solution to their problems whether through the traditional business case approach or a bespoke process.Â§        Â§We are looking for a high performing person with a real passion for Transport Planning who is motivated to learn, to develop, to listen to our clients' needs and work in a collaborative and team-based environment to deliver for our clients. In this role, you will have plenty of scope for success with wide exposure across projects and working with our technical experts, providing you with extensive career and professional development opportunities. You will have the opportunity to make this role your own as well as learning from leading Transport Planners and technical directors in our nationwide business. Â§        Â§Located in our New Plymouth office, you have all the benefits of living in an amazing coastal location with excellent outdoor living that the Taranaki region brings, and working within the close knit Beca family that this office enjoys.Â§        Â§About you | Te rongoÄÂ§        Â§Our Transport Planners come from a broad range of backgrounds and professions. You could have a background in geography, anthropology, economics, or the more traditional engineering backgrounds however you need to be ready to make a difference and understands the 'craft' of providing quality advice while balancing a broad range of stakeholder viewpoints to deliver a transport outcome. You will be working with central transport agencies, different community and iwi groups, contractors and the general public. You will be a people person creating the environment to express, understand and work with very different viewpoints. jobText: TXT/50881184.txt	Â§Manager Strategy, Reporting and MonitoringÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Manager Strategy, Reporting and MonitoringÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Fire and Emergency New ZealandÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§4 Nov 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Strategy & PlanningÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§  Â§    Â§      Â§Manager Strategy, Reporting and Monitoring Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§        Â§About usÂ§        Â§Fire and Emergency New Zealand was set up under new legislation in July 2017, combining 40 urban and rural fire services and 14,000 people. We became one national emergency management organisation to keep New Zealanders, their property and our unique environment safe.Â§        Â§We respond to structure and vegetation fires. And while the core role of firefighters is to put out fires, it is much more than that.Â§        Â§We rescue people involved in transport accidents or other incidents, urban search and rescue, deal with dangerous substances, weather events and natural disasters.Â§        Â§Our firefighters educate communities to prepare for emergencies, prevent and mitigate them, and teach them how to recover more quickly when they do happen.Â§        Â§We also assist other agencies in the response to medical emergencies, maritime incidents and vehicle accidents. Nothing is more important to us than our people - he waka eke noa.Â§        Â§We are building a workplace that is safe, respectful and inclusive for all our people. It is fundamental to our purpose and consistent with our values. We activity embrace and value diversity and welcome people from all backgrounds.Â§        Â§About the you Â§        Â§We are looking for an energetic, experienced people manager, with a strong understanding of the machinery of government, statutory reporting, production of accountability documents and medium-term strategy and planning documents.Â§        Â§You will manage a busy, fast paced team that is responsible for helping the business understand and manage its strategic direction, meet its performance, monitoring, reporting and statutory accountability obligations.Â§        Â§You will come from an organisational strategy or a planning and performance background. You'll lead the team outputs, which include development and implementation of the National Strategy, 10-year plan, statutory accountability documents, performance reporting and monitoring of organisational performance.Â§        Â§You will be familiar with planning, performance reporting and monitoring processes in the New Zealand government sector and have proven experience producing high quality documents, advice and papers for senior audiences - ELT and Board members.Â§        Â§The team sits in a Strategy and Performance directorate alongside three other teams, and you'll be part of the Directorate Leadership team and will work closely with the other teams, to deliver key work for the directorate.Â§        Â§This is a permanent role, starting salary is approximately $141,000 per annum, our benefits include matched KiwiSaver employer contributions of up to 6%, life and income protection insurance, and generous sick leave provisions through our wellness policy.Â§        Â§If you are up for a challenge, come and join us on our journey.Â§        Â§Interested in applying?Â§        Â§For more information about this position please go to our websiteÂ§www.fireandemergency.nzÂ§and download a copy of the position description apply online.Â§        Â§Applications close Sunday, 22 November 2020.Â§      Â§      Â§      Â§    Â§    Â§  Â§Â§Â§About usÂ§Fire and Emergency New Zealand was set up under new legislation in July 2017, combining 40 urban and rural fire services and 14,000 people. We became one national emergency management organisation to keep New Zealanders, their property and our unique environment safe.Â§We respond to structure and vegetation fires. And while the core role of firefighters is to put out fires, it is much more than that.Â§We rescue people involved in transport accidents or other incidents, urban search and rescue, deal with dangerous substances, weather events and natural disasters.Â§Our firefighters educate communities to prepare for emergencies, prevent and mitigate them, and teach them how to recover more quickly when they do happen.Â§We also assist other agencies in the response to medical emergencies, maritime incidents and vehicle accidents. Nothing is more important to us than our people - he waka eke noa.Â§We are building a workplace that is safe, respectful and inclusive for all our people. It is fundamental to our purpose and consistent with our values. We activity embrace and value diversity and welcome people from all backgrounds.Â§About the you Â§We are looking for an energetic, experienced people manager, with a strong understanding of the machinery of government, statutory reporting, production of accountability documents and medium-term strategy and planning documents.Â§You will manage a busy, fast paced team that is responsible for helping the business understand and manage its strategic direction, meet its performance, monitoring, reporting and statutory accountability obligations.Â§You will come from an organisational strategy or a planning and performance background. You'll lead the team outputs, which include development and implementation of the National Strategy, 10-year plan, statutory accountability documents, performance reporting and monitoring of organisational performance.Â§You will be familiar with planning, performance reporting and monitoring processes in the New Zealand government sector and have proven experience producing high quality documents, advice and papers for senior audiences - ELT and Board members.Â§The team sits in a Strategy and Performance directorate alongside three other teams, and you'll be part of the Directorate Leadership team and will work closely with the other teams, to deliver key work for the directorate.Â§This is a permanent role, starting salary is approximately $141,000 per annum, our benefits include matched KiwiSaver employer contributions of up to 6%, life and income protection insurance, and generous sick leave provisions through our wellness policy.Â§If you are up for a challenge, come and join us on our journey.Â§Interested in applying?Â§For more information about this position please go to our websiteÂ§www.fireandemergency.nzÂ§and download a copy of the position description apply online.Â§Applications close Sunday, 22 November 2020.Â§Â§Â§Â§Right to live and workÂ§Â§You must have theÂ§ right to live and work Â§in this location to apply for this job.Â§Â§Â§

jobTitle: Manager - Operational Workforce Development Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50881107.txt	Â§Manager - Operational Workforce DevelopmentÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Manager - Operational Workforce DevelopmentÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Ministry of EducationÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§4 Nov 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§WellingtonÂ§, Â§Wellington CentralÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Corporate DevelopmentÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa, and welcome.Â§Permanent - full-timeÂ§Set up and lead our new operational workforce teamÂ§Change, the customer experience, culture and values, capability development, workforce planning, resource allocation, can it get any better than that? Read on.Â§Help shape the future of educationÂ§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.Â§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.Â§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.Â§About usÂ§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.Â§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.Â§About the roleÂ§Reporting to the Group Manager - Business Services, this new role will lead the newly forming Workforce team to ensure the consistent development and delivery of a range of best practice operational workforce strategies, programmes and initiatives across Education Infrastructure Service (EIS) to enhance people capability across the EIS group.Â§Your key priorities will include the following:Â§Development of an EIS wide workforce development strategy and planÂ§Develop and lead the implementation and delivery of change management, L&D, workforce planning, culture and values, customer experience workstreamsÂ§Work with business leaders to develop and prioritise workforce initiatives and resourcing requirementsÂ§About youÂ§Where to start - a workforce specialist and generalist all in one. Someone who can see the bigger picture yet gets lots of operational stuff done. Influence, engage, collaborate, deliver and build key relationships within the business.Â§You will also offer the following:Â§Proven experience in a leadership or management role delivering end-to-end solutionsÂ§Experience as a programme or project lead for large scale projectsÂ§Ability to think strategically at conceptual levelsÂ§Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good stakeholder relationshipsÂ§Astute business acumen knowledge and skillsÂ§The ability to influence externally and at a senior level and be a credible representativeÂ§The ability to understand and apply the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and tangata whenuatangaÂ§If you'd like to bring your skills to a challenging but rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.Â§Are you ready to make a difference?Â§We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including MÄori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.Â§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with MÄori students, their whÄnau, hapÅ« and iwi.Â§Please review the job description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'apply online' button. Â§For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at Â§eis.recruitment@education.govt.nzÂ§Â§ Applications close at midnight on Thursday, 19 November 2020.Â§Click here to view the role descriptionÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Right to live and workÂ§Â§You must have theÂ§ right to live and work Â§in this location to apply for this job.Â§Â§Â§

However, the threats we face are growing in scale and complexity - changing risk pathways, climate change and pressure from established pests. jobText: TXT/50874672.txt	Â§Senior Geotechnical EngineerÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Job DescriptionÂ§Â§Job HeaderÂ§Â§Senior Geotechnical EngineerÂ§Â§Advertiser:Â Â§Mott MacDonald Australia and New ZealandÂ§Â§More jobs from this companyÂ§Â§Â§Â§Job InformationÂ§Â§Job Listing DateÂ§Â§4 Nov 2020Â§Â§LocationÂ§Â§AucklandÂ§Â§Work TypeÂ§Â§Full TimeÂ§Â§ClassificationÂ§Â§Consulting & StrategyÂ§, Â§Environment & Sustainability ConsultingÂ§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§Â§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }Â§Â§  Â§    Â§    Â§      Â§Senior Geotechnical Engineer Â§      Â§        Â§Job Description:Â§Mott Macdonald has a new job opening for an established Senior Geotechnical Engineer to be based in Central Auckland. Your focus will be on ANZ projects but you will also support other offices globally by providing internal support services related to tunnelling, foundations, retaining structures and slopes on civil infrastructure projects.Â§Where required you will prepare specifications and reports and carry out site inspections as well as attend client meetings and manage the client interface on progressively larger and more complex projects. We recognise the importance of career development and will ensure that you will be mentored and supported as you develop with us. Â§In this varied role, your day to day activities will include:Â§* Work with internal and external clients as a member of the geotechnical team. Â§* Assisting in scoping geotechnical aspects of projects. Â§* Supervision of drafting personnelÂ§* Site inspections and reporting.Â§* Field monitoring and data assessment. Â§* Advise our internal professionals in our roads, tunnel, aviation, water and structural engineering groupsÂ§* Assist as a team member on geotechnical related projects.Â§* Apply your understanding of construction methods.Â§* Preparation of reports and specifications.Â§Candidate Specification:Â§You will be a degree qualified Civil Engineer or Geotechnical Engineer. This role suits someone with several years post graduate experience, who is looking to develop alongside a team of high performing geotechnical professionals. Â§In addition to the above, you will have:Â§* Experience in ground characterisation.Â§* Experience in seismic assessments and designÂ§* Experience in geotechnical design.Â§* Experience in project management.Â§* Appreciation of engineering risk.Â§* Developing an understanding of commercial risk.Â§* Preparedness to innovate and think outside the square.Â§* Willingness to contribute to any reasonable request.Â§* Ongoing development of professional skills.Â§You will be working on significant projects that shape the communities in which we live. You will build connections with our local and international experts and bring this knowledge to our clients and to their projects. We adopt a pioneering mindset to meet our challenges head on.Â§With a solid base of technical knowledge and experience in geotechnical projects, we seek a person who is technically focused but able to be client minded with great all-round skills in presentation and communication. Â§Job Profile:Â§Mott MacDonald is one of the largest independent employee-owned companies in the world. It is a multisector consultancy providing engineering, management, and development services on projects in 150 countries. With over 16,000 of the best people working on a diverse range of challenges, we're helping our clients deliver sustainable infrastructure and development solutions. Â§We have a collegiate and collaborative culture which values equality and diversity, and we take proactive steps to create an inclusive workplace.
